intro: Henriettella ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf henriettella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its ovate, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Henriettella ovata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
